summary: This document is an email chain from March 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a call from a woman who identified herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence details attempts to coordinate a follow-up by law enforcement agents and provides background on previous, unproductive communications with the victim's former attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the perpetrator by a woman who called the U.S. Attorney's Office claiming to be a former victim.

events.title: Epstein Victim Calls U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: A woman named (name redacted) called the U.S. Attorney's Office, identified herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein, and requested follow-up.

events.title: Victim Follow-up Call
events.description: The same victim called again looking for a follow-up from the authorities.

events.title: Internal Coordination for Victim Contact
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel internally coordinate, with one official pinging agents for a third time to have them reach out to the insistent victim.

keyFacts: In February 2021, a woman contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office claiming to be a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein and seeking follow-up.
The victim stated she had been represented by an attorney (name redacted) for the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund but was not currently represented.
The U.S. Attorney's Office had prior unproductive communications with this attorney in 2020, where he claimed to represent at least nine Epstein victims unwilling to speak with prosecutors.
The email chain shows internal efforts and delays within the U.S. Attorney's Office in having case agents respond to the victim's repeated calls over several weeks in March 2021.
